titles.title: Expressing the sense of the Congress in support of the National Anthem "SingAmerica" project.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Government Reform.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Mr. Turner (OH) moved to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H. Con. Res. 262.

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.

VACATING ORDER FOR YEAS AND NAYS - Mr. McKeon asked unanimous consent that the order for the yeas and nays on the question of adoption of the motion to suspend the rules and agree to H. Con. Res. 262 be vacated, to the end that the Chair put the question on the motion de novo. Agreed to without objection.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate and referred to the Committee on the Judiciary.

bill.summary: 11/4/2003--Passed House without amendment. Commends MENC (the National Association for Music Education), the Smithsonian Institution, the American Sportscasters Association, and all those involved in the National Anthem "SingAmerica" project for their initiative to promote national awareness of the patriotic musical heritage of the United States. Urges all Americans to participate in SingAmerica.
